result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Holland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $189.00 to Janquishian A.  Joint and several with 14CF1504.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.  Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No contact with victims or coactors.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programing conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Restituition, DNA surcharges, court costs.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and consecutive to any  other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions same as in count one.

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended counts:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5  YEARS with 577 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5  YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5  YEARS with any credit days remaining from Count 1 CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5  YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- take any prescribed medications
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- No contact with victims
- No contact with co-actors
- Provide a DNA sample.
  Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $189.00 to Janquishlan A. joint and several with 14CF1504 
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay  court costs;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter or Cash Bail to apply
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information.  Charges amended on 8/21/2014 in Branch 22.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Tom Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Competency Hearing proceeded.  Sworn and testified via video for the State:  Dr. Karyn Gust-Brey.  Arguments heard.  Court placed findings on the record.  Court finds defendant is competent to proceed.  Cash bond remains as set with same bail conditions as previously ordered.  Case adjourned for court trial in Branch 19.  Court trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctor's report. Defendant refusing to leave his cell. Defense counsel is not contesting the findings of the report, but cannot speak to the wishes of the defendant. State requests a hearing.  Doctor to appear via video conference on the next court date. All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Dept of Health Services report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
dated 6-23-15 from Department of Health Services requesting copy of NGRI evaluation completed by Deborah Collins, Psy.D.  in 2014, received and filed.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.    The Court found that an inpatient examination is necessary and committed the defendant to DHS for a competency examination and report pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2)(3) of Wisconsin Statutes.  Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Court Trial. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered Court Trial date of 5/11/15 vacated.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice and motion for competency examination from the defense received and filed.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Newly appointed defense attorney is not ready to proceed with court trial on 03/06/2015.  New court trial date is chosen.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Court trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests  more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tanz
informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  For now court trial is left on the calendar.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant received and filed.  Parties contacted and motion hearing scheduled for 02/12/2015 at 8:30am.

INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $468.75 to Dr.Collins for services on 12-10-14, 12-17-14.
COPY IN FILE.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest findings, which state that there is no evidence the defendant suffered from a mental disease or defect on the date of the offense.  There is also no data that he lacked substantial capacity to understand the wrongfulness of his acts.  Defense wishes to proceed with Court Trial.  Jury waiver received and filed.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Court trial scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to address defendant's non-compliance with the evaluation.  Counsel has spoken with him, and he will be cooperating.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for return on doctors report on 12/19/2014 at 8:30am.

Letter from Behavioral Consultants, defendant is now willing to participate in the exam.  Dr. Collins is requesting a return on doctors report for 12/21/2014, however Branch 22 will not be in session that day.  Return on doctors report set for 12/19/2014 at 8:30am.
Letter from Dr. Collins dated 10/22/2014 received and filed.  Defendant declined evaluation.  Parties notified.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered the forensic unit to examine the defendant for NGI.   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 22.  Filed, signed Order for Examination.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Dalonis W. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26202619 in court 1x on 8/20/14.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/21/14 for Dalonis W. for 1 appearance on  8/20/14.
See case no. 14cf1504 for request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/21/14 for Janquishlan A. for 2 appearances on 8/18/14, 8/20/14.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was passed in anticipation of a plea hearing, however Attorney Taylor informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Court date of 09/02/2014 is ordered vacated.  Speedy trial demand is removed.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Miranda-Goodchild Hearing.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Shannon Lewandowski.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the State's motion to introduce defendant's statement at Jury Trial.  Defense requests a short adjournment for plea hearing, case is passed.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to (Count 1 & 2) Robbery, Threat of Force, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, a Class E Felony.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court of Jury Trial, for reasons stated on the record, case is adjourned in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Current bail and all previous terms and conditions remain the same.  Jury Trial scheduled for 08-20-2014 remains on Court's Calendar.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to jury trial taking place in Branch 22, this matter was held off the record.  As stated in previous hearing, Defendant's Counsel reasserts Defendant's SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND today.  Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for 06-25-2014 at 08:30am and  Jury trial scheduled for 08-20-2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, Speedy Jury Trial, scheduled for 06-09-2014 is removed from Court's Calendar.  Court finds reasonable cause to stay  Speedy Trial Demand at this point. Court informs counsels that court will make every effort to schedule Jury Trial in this matter as expeditiously as possible; however, defendant may reassert right to Speedy Jury Trial Demand during Status Conference, if necessary.  Status Conference is scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30pm.
FILE REMAINS IN COURTROOM PENDING STATUS CONFERENCE.

Attorney Darryl in court on behalf of Attorney Valeria L Taylor, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared on behalf of Thomas L Potter for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  BAIL and ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Steven E Holland not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference held.  Final Pretrial and Jury Trial scheduled for a later date in Branch 22. Final Pretrial scheduled for 06-02-2014 at 08:30am and Jury Trial scheduled for 06-09-2014.
Bail motion to be heard during Scheduling Conference on 05-01-2014 at 01:30pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL, FILED BY ATTORNEY VALERIA TAYLOR.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of witnesses in this matter.  Sworn for the state:Kenton Burtch-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling Conference on May 1, 2014 at 1:30 p.m. and Bail/Bond Hearing May 1, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shanyeill M., Marquise L., Janquishlan A., Dalonis W., Rosette A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven E Holland in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Steven E Holland in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
